name: Roy Phillips

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Great job kid! Meet me around front.

topics.topic: MS12FinMurderedTopicWhere are the other Tenpenny Tower residents?
topics.topic_text: I notice a distinct lack of non-Ghoul tenants.
topics.response_text: Let's just say those two-faced smoothskins didn't like the new management. So they all got themselves "evicted." Can't say it's a shame.{deeply amused that he has murdered a bunch of people}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: Beats the Wasteland and dirty tunnels, that's for damn sure!{happy not to be homeless}

topics.topic_text: So what are you doing in the Metro tunnels?
topics.response_text: Biding our time, making plans, getting ready. Tenpenny and his pack of elitist wannabes can't keep us out of that tower forever.

topics.topic_text: I might be able to get you in there.
topics.response_text: I already got a plan. They think I’m a monster. I’ll show them the real monsters!{angry but amused about his scheme for vengeance}

topics.topic_text: Right on. Kill those elitists. I think I can help you with that escape door.
topics.response_text: Now you're talking my language. Alright, here's the plan.{starting to like the player}

topics.topic_text: This is going to be fun!
topics.response_text: Indeed. Remember. I'll be waiting for you to get that door open. Don't keep me waiting long, kid.{reminding his enthusiastic co-conspirator about the plan}

topics.topic_text: Well, maybe I should talk to Tenpenny. There may be a peaceful solution.
topics.response_text: Try it if you like. Go talk to Tenpenny. Ask him he wants us living there.  It won't work. So when you fail, we can do it my way.{scoffing at a bad idea}

topics.topic_text: Let me try talking to Tenpenny. Maybe he wouldn't mind you living there.
topics.response_text: Ha! Those snooty bitches probably can't stand living with each other, let alone with us.{amused by the player's naivete}

topics.topic_text: It's not really any of my business. Sorry I asked.
topics.response_text: You're right. It's none of your business. You best get out of here, kid. Before something ugly happens.{threatening}

topics.topic_text: It's Tenpenny's tower. He can do whatever he wants.
topics.response_text: Not sure where you come from kid, but out here in the Wasteland, everything's up for grabs. And you only get to keep what you can hold onto.{tough guy schooling a naive do-gooder}

topics.topic_text: Whatever. You're no better than Tenpenny.
topics.response_text: If I'm no better than Tenpenny, then he should let me into that tower. But he won't. So, I'm busting in.{defending his hardline plan to kill Tenpenny}

topics.topic_text: Whatever. I'm leaving.
topics.response_text: That's the smartest thing you've said since you met me.{smoldering with anger}

topics.topic_text: Good luck with that. I'll have none of it.
topics.response_text: You got a lot to learn, kid. A lot. Like for instance how not to piss off an angry Ghoul. You best get out of here, before I get real ugly.{threatening}

topics.topic_text: You're a zombie! People should shoot you!
topics.response_text: Oh yeah? Fine. It's on!{ responding to a challenge... starting a fight  }

topics.topic_text: You're secure in these tunnels. Why try to get into Tenpenny, anyway?
topics.response_text: Ghouls aren't built for luxury and comfort, is that it? You think Ghouls belong scurrying around in the dark dank under belly of the Wasteland?{getting angry at a bigot}

topics.topic_text: I'll get that door open, and then you can let your hordes in.
topics.response_text: Well get going, then! Open the door! What's taking you so damn long? Hurry up!{Anxious to put his master plan into action}

topics.topic: MS12GhoulGREETINGMoveInI can get them to let you move in / You can now move in.
topics.topic_text: I think I can convince them to let you live there.
topics.response_text: You think so, do you? Give it a shot kid, but you're dreaming. I'll wait to give you a shot, but then we're doing it my way.{pessimistic}

topics.topic_text: Gustavo hired me to kill you.
topics.response_text: Is that so? He isn't man enough to do it himself? Sends a boy to do his dirty work. You think you got what it takes?{flexing before a fight}

topics.topic_text: Relax. It's just a warning, not a threat. I'm not going to kill you.
topics.response_text: I see...  that's smart of you. I'd lay you flat if you tried anything stupid. So don't.{overcoming his suspicion the player is setting him up}

topics.topic_text: Anything you want to say before you meet your maker?
topics.response_text: Yeah. FUCK YOU!

topics.topic_text: I don't have to kill you. If you were to give me a handful of caps...
topics.response_text: You picked the wrong Ghoul to fuck with, kid.{restrained but angry as hell and about to start shooting}

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: I'm getting impatient.{starting to get annoyed}

topics.topic_text: What happened to Mister Tenpenny?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid Tenpenny and I had little disagreement. Not to worry though. He soon had a little "accident." Problem solved.{happily smiling while talking about killing someone he hated.}

topics.topic_text: So tell me, what's it like being a Ghoul?
topics.response_text: You better choose your next words really carefully, cause you're startin' to piss me off...{threatening}

topics.topic_text: You eat people's brains, right? So what's it like being a zombie?
topics.response_text: You got balls. Real big ones. I'll assume you're kidding 'cause no one shit talks me and lives.{threatening to uphold his bluster, but deep down likes the player for being a tough guy}

topics.topic_text: I didn't mean to offend. I'm not prejudiced.
topics.response_text: Sure, whatever you say. You pretentious two-faced asshole.{telling the player off for being a bigot who pretends not to be prejudiced}

topics.topic_text: You're the prejudiced asshole, not me. So you're ugly. Big deal.
topics.response_text: Maybe I misjudged. Pardons. So yeah, people treat us like shit. But it just makes us stronger.{gruff but coming to like the player because he's a frank straight talker, he is discussing his condition of being a Ghoul}

topics.topic_text: No, really. I mean it. I don't care if you're a Ghoul or not.
topics.response_text: Uh-huh? Fine, whatever. Being a Ghoul ain't anything worse than any other thing somebody's got to deal with.{doesn't believe the player is being sincere, but bugrudingly giving him the benefit of the doubt}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Uh-huh. Didn't think so.{said dismissively to someone who just backed down from a fight}

topics.topic_text: Ah... Nevermind.
topics.response_text: Right. I thought so. I'm warning you. I don't take shit from no one.{assuming the worst of the person he is talking to}

topics.topic_text: Mind your fucking business, that's who.
topics.response_text: Listen good. I'll say this only once. I can respect a man's privacy. But I don't put up with bullshit.{setting down the law firmly (but likes that the player has guts to talk to him rudely)}

topics.topic_text: You got nothing to worry about. I'm harmless.
topics.response_text: Harmless? Well, you're lucky I don't stick you and take your shit. Watch yourself, we don't take kindly to strangers, 'specially sweet-talking ones.{haughty and threatening}

topics.topic_text: <Say nothing.>
topics.response_text: Not much to say? That's good. It'll keep you out of trouble. Be warned: don't cause me or mine no problems, or I'll end you.{suspicious and threatening}

topics.topic_text: I killed a bunch of crazy Ghouls in the Metro tunnels...
topics.response_text: So you you killed a bunch of Feral Ghouls. Is that supposed to sound impressive?{dismissive}

conversation.response_text: Hurry up. Those bigots got big comeuppance waiting for them. I mean to give it to them soon. Now get!{letting his anger mix with enthusiasm}
Well? Is it done yet? Did you get that door open?{impatient}
Look, Burke. I... I don't care how you got past the others. I could... I could have you torn apart in an instant, with a snap of my fingers!
You can tell Tenpenny he can kiss my ass! We got plenty of bottlecaps! Let me in, goddamnit!{yelling at a obstinate enemy on the other end of an intercom}
Great job kid! Meet me around front. I have something for you to keep the ferals from gnawing on your ass!{excited and blood thirsty}

combat.response_text: Die, bitch!{angry ghoul glad to be killing things}

description:
Roy Phillips is a 100 year-old Human (pre-War) Male.

Roy is a weathered pre-War ghoul with a stern demeanor and a no-nonsense attitude. His once-polished uniform is now tattered, but he carries himself with the authority of his former life. His face is a roadmap of decay, but his eyes burn with intensity and conviction. As the leader of a group of ghoul dissidents, he commands respect through his unwavering principles and tactical mind.

Roy Phillips's Personality: Roy possesses a rigid, black-and-white worldview that has survived his transformation into a ghoul. He demands that humans treat ghouls with basic respect and has no patience for bigots. Despite his hardened exterior, he cares deeply for his fellow ghouls and will go to extreme lengths to secure their safety and dignity. His past as a police officer instilled in him a strong sense of justice, though his methods have become more extreme in the post-War world.

Roy Phillips's Backstory: Roy Phillips served as a police officer in Washington D.C. before the Great War. When the bombs fell, he was exposed to significant radiation, transforming him into a ghoul. Despite this change, he maintained his sense of justice and leadership qualities. Over the decades, he gathered other ghouls who had been rejected by human society, forming a community in the Warrington Metro Station tunnels. His relationship with Bessie Lynn, another ghoul in his group, provides a rare moment of tenderness in his otherwise hardened existence.
